content: First of all, I've been using the desktop version 2 - never upgraded to version 3. I got a tablet, so I decided that I'd get the Android version. After struggling a bit, I figured I can send profiles and recipes from one to the other using the "Cloud" which allows to share 15 recipes for free. I was also able to copy my equipment from the Desktop version to the tablet (transfer a recipe with the right profile to the cloud - check the profile details within the recipe and save to your mobile instance). So people that complain it's not possible to go from one to the other, please try and check online info before complaining. I think the 15 recipes for the free cloud account is good enough to get you going. If you want more, you should get the full cloud account. This being said, the UI is not the greatest - I agree. I guess you get used to it after a while, but It's not the case for me yet. I'm used to have the desktop brewsheet printed where I can check off things and write readings so it's easier to follow. But, the essential info is there and that's the important. I do think it's a good tool that needs getting used to it. It does allow me to plan and execute my brew day using a recipe I developped on the Desktop verstion - that's all which is important. Therefore, I guess it's an allright tool for me.

Some of the worst UX/UI I have ever come across. For example pressing the Save button and then nothing happens. Then having to press Cancel to get back to a previous page. Weird brew day timer issues where I can't pause or resume properly. And some really basic features are missing. How do I make a copy of a recipe? How do I make a copy of equipment?
Can't save recipes anymore. This is BS! Fix it now! Two months later 12/9/2020 still no fix. You guys suck. I want a refund and I'll be using Brewfather instead.
replyContent: To assist with this issue, it would be helpful to have a little bit more information. Can you send any screenshots related to the issue along with your device details at beersmith@beersmith.com? Thanks.

content: Used to be a great app but the latest update has nuked it. Can't open, add, or download recipes now.
How I can see what email I used to log in to this app?

Apparently there is no way to export recipe data? Only make a copy within the app that can only be viewed in the app? This lock-in makes me very sad. It's enough that Apple and Google and Amazon are locking people into their eco systems, sad to see an indie developer doing the same.
It was great. But the fermentation data section has stopped working. Feels like an update gone wrong
replyContent: The fermentation data section has been moved to the Recipe editor. Edit a recipe and scroll down to the session button to add data.

content: Latest firmware has lost the link to the breda session notes
replyContent: The session notes are now available on the main recipe edit page. Open the recipe for editing and scroll down to the session button.

content: Hard to use, mostly due to clunky UI. Still the best brew app available...
replyContent: I just posted a 3.1.9 update after correcting some serious problems with Android 7 and 7.1.1. It should correct your issues.

content: Great
It has everything I need
Love this. It will me being a beginner brewer.
I use beersmith everytime I brew. I can design every detail including water additions, malt bill, equipment profile etc. It does things I don't even know about!
Make changes to your brew on brew day and see the results instantly.
Easiest brewing software to use!
Fantastic!!
Enjoy this immensely!
Lost recipes on upgrade, javascript errors, no way to revert to back v2, wont save new recipes.... useless. Look forward to a new version to fix it all.

It's time to change User Interface and make mobile version at least close to the desktop version and show the options desktop version has like export/important, bu:gu calculation on the recipe form and other
Awesome app for home brewing

It is nice to have one location for all my beers. I wish the reminders would work with Google or outlook calendar so that I would get reminders during secondary and primary not just on brewery. It would be nice if the hops could be rolled up into a summary so I would have a better idea of total hops required for a beer as I do a lot of DBL IPAs
Deletes all your recipes periodically... Need I say more!

Loses recipes. No import of beer.xml files Lots of tools. Generally a good app, but constantly messes up my recipes lists with duplicates and lost recipes. There are 2 built in tools to try to recover lost recipes so this is a known bug. No way to transfer recipes from one phone to another phone (except to your online account and back, one at a time)

It was difficult to dial this into my system. I tried several times and could never get it right. My numbers were always off, anywhere from half a gallon to a full gallon. My efficiency was always way low. I took the last batch entered it into brew father and I was within 1 point.
App is terrible. There are free versions out there that work just as good if not better
Pretty poor, and clunky interface, there are better options out there, that are both more user friendly as well as offer better options.
One of the most useless apps ever

Three stars at best from my perspective. My experience has been if you are trying to develop a certain beer recipe from a known recipe it is resistive to doing so. In the past I have been very positive regarding Beersmith products. Not any more, my enthusiasm has sharply diminished. I would look else where for a brewing software.
Handy but overly complicated to use when compared to the desktop app. One issue tho. I'm unable to enter in the OG value in my recipe. It just won't save the number.

Stupid to use. Can't actually edit half the things you want to on your phone(even though you PAY for the app), you can't collaborate with anyone, and best thing is after you pay for the app you can only store 15 recipes on the cloud. really beersmith? Really wanted to like the app but I can't after trying to use it for 6+ months.

Hi Brad, love the desktop version and the mobile app (desktop is better with more resolution for water adjustments). Will there be a future version which integrates desktop and mobile more closely, so a separate purchase is not required for both applications?
I forgot I even bought this. It's not very good when compared to the desktop ap. I tried to build a recipe, gave up and never opened it again.
Very good, complicated at first, but as your brewing experience grows, so will your ability to get more from the app.
Good app, nice that they make updates. I just wish that I could sync inventory from my computer. Useless to not have my inventory list available when at the brew store.

Oldie but goldie. Desktop and mobile versions were written long before industry standard moved to the cloud or became more "social". These features were implemented along the way. Some may think that they're not super intuitive, but are working good enough. Only thing for Brad, you'd rewrite it as progressive web app (as competition is slowly doing). These are the future, soon app/playstores will be gone! ;)
This application randomly deletes the recipes you take the time and energy to design.... it deletes entire folder for no reason
Excellent App
Cannot endorse this app. Too many bugs and missing features to warrant purchasing it.
Fully functional software. Than you. Recipe edit seem unnecessarily cumbersome. But WARNING, the cloud server syncing function tends to corrupt recipes!!

Not very clear on how everything adds up and when it came time to figure out how much water to add it made me ruin a batch because I misread it. So kind of my bad but had it been clear I'd have given 5 stars. Still a great app and helps me calculate all my mash loss and any other variables to have a great brew each time (after I kind of figured out the water. this time I didnt hit my volume for my fermenter I was aiming for so it was less than 5 gallons. I wish this was better)
this app sux. The user interface is garbage, changing ingredients is a pain. Building recipes is a pain. And dont trust the water chemistry calcs, because they are way off.

I can't trust this app, recipes or entire folders disappear randomly, ingredient values change periodically. It's fine for building a recipe but I have to store past recipes elsewhere. I'm looking for an alternative.
All in all it is a good app. If there were some way to import beerxml files then I'd give it 5 stars. Silly that it can't especially when you pay.
This app deleted all of my recipes! Don't waste you time or $ on this clunky piece of software.

Cool for getting a general recipe in the works when you're just getting started. BUT the gravity, SRM, and IBU outlines have never matched up on the brew day. I've had better luck when my friend made recipes for me on the PC version.
Great app, couldnt brew without it.

App just deleted all recipes without rhyme or reason. All historical brews and all future ones too. Don't trust the app save hard copies if you want them to survive. Otherwise it works as expected but not deleting your users data seems pretty basic of an ask

great app. Just wish I could add a second packaging step and have it calculated based on that per package type.. example- I have a 21L batch but I want to keg 19L at 2.5/volume carbonation.. the other 2L I want to bottle. the amount of CO2 is calculated for the entire batch of 21l not the 19l I am kegging so if I were to follow it, the beer would be under carbonated.. hope that makes sense
nice
great brewing program!
App wont download?
very good app

My recipes are magically deleted. Could never export them anyways because they want you to pay extra for their cloud service. So now they are just gone. The UI is atrocious. Can't believe I paid for this. This is supposed to be the industry standard and it barely functions. FIX THIS!
This app has helped me go from a noobie know nothing into a seasoned brewer with numerous recipes of my own design under my belt. i couldnt recommend it enough!!
i wouldn't be able brew without it!

The Desktop software is great and the app is useful for some situations. The problem is that there isnt seamless cloud integration. you have to physically move your desktop files into a cloud folder. It would br great if they entirety of your data were accessible via cloud.
love this app
cannot beat it hands down the best thx
No complaints. Great app.
Will not download or install.
the best brewing software you can get!
i like this app. i would like to suggest adding an option to print or export your ingredients lists for shopping or ordering supplies.

Cannot save recipes to device, or to the cloud. Pretty frustrating considering I had to buy this app twice. update: still cannot save recipes. and now I can't add hops to the ingredient list. the suggested fix erases my current recipe, and doesn't fix the issue. down from two to one stars.
replyContent: Go to the system settings and make sure that the BeerSmith app has permission to save data to your SD card which should correct any data save issues.

content: I've had this app for three days and have been migrating recipes from another app. In three days I've had one folder and two recipes disappear, twice. I was able to recover the recipes by "rebuilding" the recipe list in the options menu, but now I can't trust the app to store my recipes. Otherwise I love the app, but so far its calculators are not worth the risk or the time lost backing up recipes on another platform and restoring them in this app. Definitely not an app worth paying for.
works with no problems on Android Pie using pixel 2.
Lost my recipes on the app, very disappointed
There is no option to match target water profile on mobile version
App seemed great until it decided to delete all of my recipes for no reason 3 times in a row. Super dissapointed with what I thought was a great app
Love this app, it's my best friend in my nano home brewery! 🙂

Although the app is very good for building your recipes it is terrible at doing calculations if things change. I use it for building the recipe bit that is all. Half of the time my mash calculations are off, it carries a grain bill weight I have no idea where it gets it from, possibly from. Adding grain to the recipe after selecting infusion type. And it doesn't matter how many times I input my measured FG it will never save it at the top of the recipe. My Saisons frequently attenuate 86-90% and even if I go and update my brewday measurements in the recipe it will never show at the top of the page. In these respects it's not that great. Not sure if it's better than Brewers friend to be honest. If the fixed some of these issues of be happy with it.
Only bad thing is I can't print out recipes. Love everything else.
I'd like it alot more if it still had a way to send recipes from my mobile to cloud. No way to do so currently, I usually create recipes on mobile...
Terrible. It was... Acceptable when I bought it 4 or 5 years ago. But, as evident by the look of the app, it has not been updated EVER I think. Not worth it imo
This App just lost all of my recipes, I'm actually heartbroken.. I worked hard on those recipes. Ive had reliable and FREE apps before this one and they have never lost anything!
Works well
Very cool and helpful app for beer brewing. Great for storing, and sharing your beer recipes. Tons of available recipes.

Update: BS version 3.0.8 has fixed the Brew Day timers! Not only are they working again, it appears that a paused timer will no longer issue an event  notification based on the original unpaused schedule (old BS2 mobile bug). So the requirement to totally rewrite the timer code for Android was worth the wait :)  I'd give it five stars if it could pull my inventory from the BS cloud.  Cheers!
It's ok, can't get the mash set up to save, keeps reverting to default, no sparge volume calculator. Still needs work
Complex set up but great once you've got that done
Very faulty my recipes keep deleting. Water calculation all over the place
Won't let you add and edit a recipe. $8 down the drain
App crashes any time a stage finishes on the timer. Worthless app now. I wish I could go back to the old app.
Very buggy. Please fix. I just paid. Please refund.
App crashes when using brew day timers. Fix this and I'll change my review.
I love this app, Android version and pc version. BUT with the latest update the app crashes whenever an alarm is meant to sound in the brew day timer. Fix this and I'll bump it back up to 5 stars!

Liked the previous versions. Not liking this one. Version 3 has lost and corrupted some of my favorite recipes. Nearly half of my saved recipes are not found, or another recipe comes up in its place. Hours of work developing and refining recipes are lost forever. Some of them have been made and adjusted over multiple brew sessions. Even some of my recipes stored on the cloud have been affected! What's the point of paying for the gold membership if your recipes are just going to get lost or ruined? Update: I deleted all the corrupted and lost recipes. Then a couple of days ago, I found some that were corrupted and thought I had missed them. I deleted those and carefully went through every recipe I have saved to make sure there weren't anymore that I might have missed. Then today I discover another seven that are corrupted. I've now lost well over half of my recipes and some of them have been tweaked and refined over multiple brew days. Years of careful crafting and fine tuning have been lost. I'm really upset with this and going to start looking for something to use besides Beersmith. I'll be letting my Gold membership expire if it's not fixed by then. Maybe even if they do. It's so frustrating to lose all that work. Oh, and the Brew Day timer crashes and doesn't work.
Great app. A bug in the volume conversion (not calculating correct number of 375 ml bottles). Awesome for keeping track of brew day and making recipes on the go.
Love the updates

First time use since upgrade App crashes continuously, and the timer alarm 
does not notify. Old version was far slicker
App crashes during timer transitions.

Timers are not working since version 3... pretty much useless if i cant use 
the brewday timers. They coutndown but i am not getting the alarm sound

I really like this app. I did have trouble with fruit additions to a 
recipe. The app would only let me add to primary. I could change it in the 
drop down but when saved it reverted back...

Any time an addition alarm sounds, the app stops. I love this app. Please 
fix it. Galaxy S8 active.
replyContent: I posted fixes to all of the Java errors I know of - if you are still having problems please drop me a message from the BeerSmith web site.

content:
Such a great recipe making tool. Love brew day timers and data input. Cloud 
storage is worth the subscription to transfer between desktop and device, 
and share with others. New water tool is very handy, as is ability to input 
mead.

I have lost recipes twice with the purchased app. Unacceptable! Cannot 
trust it. Have stopped using it. Will find alternative. Also missing 
ability to print from mobile app.

I like being able to send my brew over to cloud so when it comes to FG time 
I put into the app and send it back over as I only ever use the laptop on 
brew day. But I would really like to be able to create a recipe using % 
instead of exact weight's. My only quirk with the app
Weyerman Malt?

Very disappointed when switching over from the computer. Batch size is 
impossible to change as the equipment profiles don't update when edited, 
which is a stupid way to choose your batch size. Menus aren't as easy to 
navigate as they should be, nor is adjusting recipes. I won't bother with 3 
since 2 doesn't work right
Wonderful app. I love it.
messed up hop names and grain measurements when opening an old beer recipe

Keeps changing the mash profiles. Puts malt I'm weird spots in recipe so 
that sparge figures are incorrect. Doesn't sync with app on my pc.

I use the desktop version. The app makes it easy to take ur recipe along to 
beer club or a contest, or to a friend's to brew. Just save it to the cloud 
from ur desktop and then grab it in this app. Simple and worth the money 
for that.

Everytime I reopen the app, all my content has been deleted. When I go through the hassle of entering all my equipment and ingredients, it won't allow me to go back and edit the recipe. It just deletes it all together. Samsung Tab user.
Love it. Only complaint is it needs perceived bitterness and better calculator for sparge water.
Best beer app I've found, would be happy to pay for more updates for ingredients and settings!! Just saying!

Has several bugs that make calculations inaccurate.  The most notable one being grain total weight not calculated correctly causing water volumes to be understated.  App has potential but needs work to be used standalone

Please make number fields number only, it's tiring having to have to change keypads for amounts whether it's grain, hops or anything numeric. They shouldn't let you type qwerty into them. Cloud storage is very limited. Otherwise pretty good once you get your gear setup
No table sugar in stand alone carbonation calculator. No water chemistry. Buggy on editing water calculator is off.

I had problems editing a recipe and thought the app was broken.  Brad responded quickly and pointed out my error...my recipe had no ingredients.  I added ingredients and all is well. Will update again once I've put it to use.
Must have brewing software!

I'm really unimpressed and want my money back. Claims to offer the ability to scale recipe sizes but doesn't have a 7.5 gallon all grain equipment profile. So fine, I go to create my own and extrapolate between the 5 and ten gallon ones. But there's NO WAY to actually CHANGE the batch size of a profile to match the equipment!  DURR that's kind of the whole point of scaling a batch - to change its size. Why on earth would I brew only 5 gallon batch sizes in a 7.5 gallon system?  And when I try to add the 2.5 gallon equipment profile I enter all the info and then it just vanishes...  This app is broken.
So easy to use and the extras are fantastic.
Cant brew without it!
This app was good, but all my recipes are mixed up and some have been lost. I tap on them and it shows other recipes.
Dont have portuguese
Brad, need to update. Lots of hops a grain missing, crashes like crazy. Expected more from BeerSmith.

This app has cost me hours to make a beer that I will never repeat.  Water use is way off and I'm told the developer is aware, but still that way.  Way better than I'm ever going to do, an extreme amount of detail, but not accurate and where it's off sucks ass.
Save your money
Love the updates and always use this app to figure out recipes. 🍻
Perfect, wonderful app, couldn't be better. Actually it could! Would be nice to be able to subscribe to the recipe cloud from the app....

I'm not sure why I payed for this. I already own a disk copy of beersmith and thought it would be nice to have the tools/information on my phone or tablet. This version doesn't even have something as simple as the water needed tool! What a waste.
Cant load hops?

Never saves my equipment profile, constantly having to readjust units to metric,every time I create a recipe and save it then tells me it cannot load and suggests removing it. I have used the desktop version for years but this app is absolute rubbish. Many other brewing apps available which are free and have no issues like this for the money I expected more I will be getting a refund.
Excellent app, extremely useful on brewdays when there is no PC at hand.
The developer is very responsive when help is needed.  I use this every brew day and for putting together recipes. Must have app for my brewery.
This app is nice and useful, but I want to organize the "my recipes" list order, and I can't. :/ I'll add that 5th star when I can.
Love this app. Would like to see a brew log option added within each recipe to adjust it and track each batch outcome. Add multiple session data for each batch.
I am having trouble getting my recipes to load.
Great. Love what you've done Brad keep up the good work.
Weyermann malt was supposed to display in mash/steep instead of boil on 2.3.4

Used to work great but now having issues. All of my recipes are gone, even ones stored on the cloud. Also I tried creating a new recipe and the categories had trouble loading. Once I finally finished a recipe and saved it, I went to go back into it and it said "could not load recipe-remove listing?" PLEASE FIX ISSUES!
Awesome app...thanks
Great app!!! Does it all, scales recipes to your size and easy to set up tour equipment profile. Could use more ingredients under misc.....lactose and other flavoring additions.
Excelent useful tool, why go anywhere else, its all there for grain brewing
Easy to use and steamline designed. From the recipe formulation and ingredients lists to the tools, well worth the small invest to your brewery.
At 1st this app was a little intimidating for a rookie like me. I used the tutorials and now I could brew without this app!
I have used BeerSmith for years. Very powerful  tool. It just keep getting better with every update.  I highly recommend it
I 'must have' tool for any level brewer
Cant change gravity, bitterness, or. Olor in the recipe section

This app is near perfect. And I use it on every brew day. A few things I would love to see... 1. Water profile manipulation like on the desktop version. Us millennials do not have PCs ☺ 2. Be able to choose what IBU calculation to use for each hop addition independently. 3. Be able to export recipes to a text file to share on forums. 4. Mash efficiency calculation. May be there, but it's not obvious. I like to see the trend of how my brew day is progressing through measurements.  Thank you again Brad for a great product!
Great for designing recipes, shopping & brew day
Love this app. Would love it more if I could export a recipe in beer XML and share it with the Grainfather Connect app ;)
From recipe designs to brew days, this app rocks. Great for beginners and more advanced brewers alike
This is a great app for your brew day, as well as just pulling out your phone to design a recipe add the idea hits, or just when you're bored.
Wish there would be shopping list on mobile.
Excellent tool for brew day and trips to the homebrew supply store!

I've been using the desktop version for years and the droid version is almost the same as of Jan 2017. Having my recipes in cloud storage is very helpful, and I can edit recipes when away from my PC. The built-in tools are very handy as is the ability to add add'l equipment & ingredients (with prices for my local store, even) I couldn't live w/o the last parts, making it essential for customs recipes, calculating costs, and even finding alternative ingredients for experimental variants of my recipes.
Unable to save OG etc figures after input. Useless. P#ssed off that I had to pay for a crap app.
Works exactly as promised. Hoping for a UI overhaul but I am already sold. I don't even use the PC client, this does it all.
I have the desktop app and Professional level membership subscription as well. Fantastic stuff.

Please, can anyone help with this? Just a couple questions. Beersmith 2. I've read that it has an expected mash ph when you pump in a recipe but mine doesn't have this feature? I can find ‘mash ph’ inside the ‘mash profile’ tab but it's just set to 5.2 unless I manually change it, which means nothing. Doesn't matter what type of malt People say you can also choose a water profile and have the app tell you what's required? Not me. Priming; can't see sugar amount required!? Nothing really works
The
Great app CONTENT but more design work is needed.  Useful upgrade: lock screen and/or drop down menu timer!

Just updated my phone to Android 6.0.1 and this app is no longer usable... keeps crashing and giving me JavaScript errors, seems to be mostly related to the timer feature specifically when trying to use the boil timer.
Needs ingredients updated every once in a while

Still one of the better mobile brew apps out there but not perfect.  I've been using BeerSmith (both desktop and mobile) for over 2 years and I can honestly say it has greatly improved my beers.  But there are definite things about the mobile app that need polishing.  For one, the interface.  It takes some getting use to.  It also isn't feature complete as the desktop version.  I can usually begin designing a recipe using the mobile app but then need to perform the final adjustments and tweaks using the desktop app.  The limited, free recipe sharing via BeerSmith's cloud is annoying.  Constantly having to shuffle recipe around, especially when co-designing/co-brewing.  One can work around the issue on the desktop app using a cloud sharing service (i.e. Dropbox) but not so with the mobile version.  But the mobile app's timer has become a critical tool during brew day.  No need having to remember to set individual timers, just load up the recipe and go!  Overall, I do recommend this to others and can't wait to see what is in store for the upcoming update.
Great app, use it all the time to brew.

Whenever I try to edit OG, IBUs, etc. nothing gets saved. It just stays stuck at 1.00 SG, 0.0 IBU, and 0.0 SRM. This app clearly has tons of functionality and let's you craft whatever beer you want from scratch, but it should work FLAWLESSLY for the amount I paid to use it.
Handy app for brewing!
App keeps changing, duplicating and deleting recipes saved in it. Now I have 4 versions of my amber and lost 4 others. TERRIBLE
When I set my cloud recipes to "shared" using the app, it doesn't work. I have to set to shared using website.
Not sure why it doesn't  import bsmx files.

But once you get the hang of it, you won't brew without it. Easy to share recipes with friends and colleagues. Cloud is awesome, let's me tweak while I'm brewing without having to go back to the office
Would be nice to have additional features such as calculator for carbonation with speise or efficiency calculator
Great app
All my recipes were wiped 3 years of work down the drain. Will do the best I can to inform ppl not to trust this app

Good app but you cannot print anything. The water profile part of the app does not work properly, it gives the values of the required water for the style your brewing, but you cannot compare it to your home water values and calculate the differences to see what additives you would need.
Removed after an 1hr  with it. Confusing, difficult interface, and buggy. Get wort it's free and with a few other calculators you are all set
No1
don't waste your money there are too many short comings compared to the desktop version
I rely on this to do the calculations before I brew, it is always correct!
Does/has everything you need. Essential for brew days.
Very useful software, but poor UI + riddled with little bugs + often crashes.
Not as good as the PC version but still damn good.

Have been running B.S. for 2 years and works great! All of us in our brew club are all linked to a B.S. cloud that allows us all to review new recipes that we create and collaborate on. If you read and watch the overview you will not have any issues but also get the p.c. version and the cloud account. All are worth every penny.

Back up your recipes, because the Android version will occasionally replace them with other recipes in your database. This wouldn't be such a problem if you were able to save more recipes to the cloud.

userName: Andre Ribeiro de Aquino Figueiredo Mello
content: Very complete and helpful
Would be at sea without this genius app!
Very handy!  I reccomend to all homebrewers.

Seems to be a great app but I am having issue changing any settings. For example the original gravity starts at 1.000 but I change and save it as 1.041 however it doesn't save and remains 1.000. Please help.
Does every thing you want.  I may not bee looking in the right spot wish it had all the info like desk top for mead and wine.
It needs more features.

The brewing software to which all other software is judged. I started as a homebrewer with BeerSmith and now I'm a professional still using BeerSmith. The mobile version is of course feature-light, but allows me to build and tweak at home- and brew, adjust, & calculate on the go. While others are playing Candy Crush I am working on my next recipe. Thank you, Brad.
While I have also used the desktop version, more and more I find this is all I use for creating, timing, and logging recipes & batches.
Love the new timer!
This app is great for designing recipes. Unfortunately, it loses them after a couple of days; Frustrating. Back to BrewR...
When trying to add my own recipes, the app won't keep the values I enter for OG, and other values.
App needs serious updating. Only thing it's good for is timers and grain list when I am at the brew store. Horrible ui and recipe creation / ingredient lists are a huge mess.

Very handy for making recipes, good customisation options. But last year during a version update, all of my personal recipes got deleted. Fortunately I keep a written brew logbook which had all my recipe details. The cloud option is there, but I highly recommend a written backup.
I have used it with ease and it has really made me grow in confidence. Brad always replies to queries and comments.  Thanks
I use it professionally. And it's quite accurate. I wish it had more plug ins for specialty malt and odd hops though.

Lot of issues mentioned in the previous user comments. I wish there was one more feature where you add all the ingredients you have and it suggests what recipes you can make out of those existing ones

It's obvious this app is no longer being developed because it lacks a lot of common ingredients and has ingredients that are obsolete. Also cloud storage is very limited so it's no good as a brew day log. Finally, it's missing an auto sync, so I'm constantly loosing recipes.

There is one feature that I would love to see on the next version; a calculator for boil point to elevation. I live in the mountains and often brew at locations other that my home. While I can calculate it, the calculator would just be very handy.

For the Android users this is basically the only up that let's you calculate and record so much information which is key for brewers. The only thing it does not do well at all are batches of a recipe for when you brew the same exact beer and want to record the numbers. Maybe it could be held in the Brew Session Data section?

The program is littered with bugs and has had no serious movement in the last year. Sometimes the program will add a totally different ingredient than the one selected. No efficiency or ABV calculation. Lost all my recipes during last upgrade
I have the desktop version and love it. A big problem I am having with the mobile version is that you will click on one recipe but it will open another.

It's great for making recipes and having a general idea of what your beer is going to turn out like. But I've lost so many recipes that I don't store them in the app anymore. Always write down your recipe as a back up.
When I try to add a new recipe I get a JavaScript error, which makes the app unusable.
Works great, a brew day timer that you didn't have to incorporate into a recipe would be fantastic
This is the most helpful brewing app I have found. I literally could not brew without it anymore. If you brew all grain, splurge for the premium version.

Installed this when I switched to all grain brewing and now I wouldn't brew without it. Makes recipe building easy and lots of style tips and tools to help get a professional tasting beer all the time. Works perfectly on my nexus 7. I'm updating this a  year later now and no complaints. It's now on my Samsung Galaxy it out lived the tablet. Would give it 6 stars if I could

Overall useful but missing some final pieces in my opinion. Brew session data should record dates (brew date, into secondary if applicable, bottling date) and the supporting gravity data at each instance. Would be nice to have reminders to check gravity based on style also, e.g. 2 weeks after brew day before transferring to secondary. The app works fairly well for recipe and brew day, but for further logging and evaluation could be easily improved.

Works okay for timers, but the fact that you can't import the same add ons as in the desktop version makes this app almost useless for building recipes. Either allow add ons or update the app with the add on content. Controls for timer audio would make this more useful as well.
Lowered my rating after losing all my recipes and profile settings for the mobile version.
Real good

this app is great in concept -- I've loved the desktop version, but dragging my laptop to my brewing area is far less handy than just using my tablet.   Unfortunately, while I haven't actually used the app for brewing yet, in just adding a recipe I've already found a serious problem: I add a grain, enter an amount for the grain, and tap "save," and if the amount is less than 1lb, it doesn't save. As long as it's 1lb or more, it saves just fine.  Additionally, I looked for a way to report this issue or get help through the app, and could not find a way.  Good in concept, but not nearly as useful as good as the desktop version.
App cannot scale receipes, crash a lot... Too expensive for an app full of bugs.

Was working great for a while,  but now I opened the app again  and all my recipes are gone,  and although it shows in connected to the cloud,  no recipes show up.  I'm not sure what changed,  but I'm disappointed that my recipes are gone.
It didn't save my recipes. Not a good user interface.
Every time I go to change the mash profilr, to create larger/smaller batches it freezes and will not let me go back to home screen!!!
Really, no one gallon option? No mosaic hops? No golden promise malt? This app is useful but not quite worth the money.
It's easy for me to pull my recipes saved from my PC whenever I'm out shopping for ingredients.
It would be great to check my warehouse with tablet in hand
No Mosaic??
wanted a fully functional app for my tablet, this app is only fully functional if you link with a PC, What about those of use without PCs? i would like a refund.
I've been using beer smith on both my desktop and S4.  Works together seamlessly.
Great app, but the app changes the setting back from metric to imperial units every time the app is opened...
Losing data on my Nexus 7. Won't retain my recipes or profiles. Worked great before but not  anymore.
Love this tool.  I use it in conjunction with the pc version.  I design my recipes on the pc, store it in the cloud, then use this app on brew day.
It was great, but all my recipes were deleted when it updated and it will only save for about 1 hr after entering a recipe. Please fix

I think the concept behind this app is great however when I put in my beer profile and then load a new recipe it never adjusts, even after adjusting the actually recipe itself it does not change the grain bill. Having 30+lbs of grain for 5 gallons is inaccurate. This isn't the first time this has happened which is frustrating. Also every time the app updates it deletes my profile and previous saved recipes. Any and all help with these problems would be greatly appreciated.
Excellent app! Thank you. May I suggest that the developer adds a function for adding photos to the recipe to serve as part of the results sheet? Thanks

Frankly this is useless. Every time I go back into the app my profiles,  recipes &  units are all reverted to factory settings.  No details on how to fix this online. Going to uninstall and try another app.

The same as JJ below (also on LG G3) this new version has also wiped my local recipes and equipment settings. Changing the units from metric to imperial resets everytime you launch the app too. Shame as I loved being to tinker with recipes when out and about but now I'll have to go through all the setup again!
Not bad, clearly a lot of work went into this. Unfortunately, BU:GU metric is absent from recipe creation
I had an issue and had it completely resolved within hours. Can't wait to brew my next beer with this app.
Great piece of brewing software. So many invaluable tools. I now formulate all of my recipes using this tool, and my quality has greatly improved. Highly recommended!

I use it for the timers on brew day and it works great. But the mobile version is not even close to being as useful for designing recipes as pc version. Also wish the inventory list was in the cloud for shopping at the LHBS.
I love this app

Perfect application for creating & storing my recipes. Until the app decided to delete EVERY SINGLE ONE OF MY RECIPES AND REVERT BACK TO DEFAULT EVERYTHING!!! Thank you for deleting my Gold Medal Imperial Stout recipe. Mother F****r!!!

Very useful app, but.....After adding a dozen or so recipes it would jumble recipes. One recipe would have the recipe name but ingredient list of another. Tap one recipe and another would show up in its place. Some just sit there 'thinking' (little rotating circle) and would just not open or allow you to delete it. Frustrating. Anyone no how to delete undeletable recipes let me know.
But it still does not have all the yeast and malt add-on options like the desktop app does, so I still have to make the all grain brews on my pc.
Love it
This is a great thing. HELPS A LOT. Does almost everything.

It's my primary (and only, now that I think about it) app for homebrewing. I like the recipe creation ability, with the different tools making a lot of the calculations for me. If I could be so bold as to make a suggestion for the app from a lazy-man's perspective? Perhaps an option to print out an ingredient list from a recipe page?
Great app
Had a user related issue, contacted programmer brad, and got reply almost immediately helping me resolve it. Awesome!
Normally this is a handy tool. But recently different recipes show up, if at all.
A must have for brewers!
Almost as good as the desktop version, I would love to be able to sync my equipment profiles with the app. Worth purchasing even if you have Beersmith 2. Thanks Brad!
Great App

Upgrading to 5 stars, I had some issue with my old tablet mid boil and it crashed (unrelated to the app). Amazingly, Beersmith kept my boil timer accurate once it rebooted! Bravo! I would like to see future updates show preboil gravity estimates if that could be included someday.

A great home brewing app. The desktop application is nice but I find this easier to use. I wish there was a more comprehensive water calculator however as thats the biggest thing I miss. Brewers friend has an excellent mash pH calc etc that would be very useful.
New update has cause recipes to go heywire. Open up one recipe but it opens a different one. Also reverts to us units eveytime i open it
Best brewing software on the market for homebrewing.

Just starting out with brewing and going straight for the deep end with all-grain BIAB. No problem at all thanks to a crash course I took -- and the Beersmith app. I hardly use the desktop version at all as the app does all I need so far.
Excellent app. Thank you for fixing the bug!
replyContent: I corrected this (literally a few hours later) with build 2.2.46 which is available on the store now.

content: Preferred the old layout with the blue buttons. And the app still doesnt have an efficiency calculator.

+ Timer + Quickly view recipies  - Non-native app, and it shows in the sub standard UI (slow, back button issues, ugly, et.c.) - Sync issues: had a problem when editing a recipie, synced, and removed from inventory on desktop beersmith. Only some items were removed and an error message was displayed.  The desktop version is quite good, but the general issues with this app and proprietary cloud are that 1) app is expensive, 2) not really an Android app, 3) only supports proprietary cloud and 4) you'll probably hit the cloud limit (15 at this time) quite fast - a paid subscription is required to increase it.
Good to have for cranking out recipes  while waiting in line at the dmv, breaks at works, the train ride to the city and so on. Love it.
Very handy app, but has some issues ...
No other way to go! Easy to use. i wish they would update new hops more often, including experimental varietals.
Would love to give it 5 stars but some key items missing that the desktop app does like total water needed.

Love this app. I've used Beersmith for years and it's one of the best tools for brewing one can buy, especially for all grain brewing. Every serious home brewer should own a version of Beersmith. Cheers!
Would like to see a little more cloud storage included or allow it to access other cloud servers.

Been a long time user of Beersmith on PC and android. The Cloud integration makes it easy to transfer recipes between the two platforms. It would be nice if equipment, mash, ingredient profiles could be transferred just as easily.
replyContent: I have a fix for the alarm issue at the beta testers now and should have it posted in the next few days.

content: Love beer smith but the latest bug of no alarm totally messed up my latest batch
Worked great. Now nothing. I have all my recipes on there. Poop!
replyContent: Just published a fix (build 39) - looks like it was having trouble with recent Android versions.

content: Do not update!
replyContent: Just published a fix (build 39) which should correct the issues.

content: I genuinely love this app. A perfect partner to the desktop version. My only gripe is the lack of social media integration. Let me share my recipes via Facebook, Twitter, SMS etc. 5 Stars otherwise.

Good to have my recipes on my phone. Also has tools but I use another app for that. Latest version update looks worse than original - formatting looks older and less refined and the splash logo is squashed horizontally now. Still wish I could import recipes from the desktop app rather than use the limited to 5 recipe free cloud service. All in all though pretty good.
A must have for a home brewer
Loved this app until the last update. Now half of my recipes don't work. Very upset
I design my beers on my phone. Tweak my recipes on my PC and brew from my laptop or tablet. This is a great tool for any level home brewer. It is even better when paired with the desktop application.
Since update my alarm is not sounding. Very frustrating
replyContent: Working the alarm issue now - should have a fix out shortly.  I just sent it to the beta testers for testing.

content: The one thing I need the software to do on brew day is set my mash strike temp based on grist and tun temp. And it seems this is something the mobile app will not do.

Loved it before. Love the subtle tweaking of the UI. BEST APP EVER for keeping track of your beer recipes and sharing with others. Combined with the website it's just awesome. I really wish more people would share their recipes though. And add more detail in comments.  Anyway- BUY THIS APP IF YOU MAKE BEER!!
Feels faster than the previous version. I would still love to know my FG while creating/editing a recipe without having to save and go back to view mode.
It's a clone of an iOS app. The Mac version of this is a PC clone!
Before now it had been perfect for me on 3 different phones.  Keeps freezing on my Note 3.  Becoming aggravating.

Every home brewer should have this app. Period. Although it can take a little trial and error to set up your rig, it contains almost every tool an all-grain brewer needs. It's the only app I've ever paid money for and it's worth every cent.
Good variety of tools and comprehensive database but...scaling is really badly implemented.  Playing with recipes is painful unless you want to make exactly the same amount every time.
I can't open up a BSMX file with this app.

Like many other all grain brewers out there I grab recipes and adjust the quantities to my systems calibrated efficiency. This efficiency calculator is missing and there is not an easy way to check how the session went.  Please add in future updates.
Keeps setting my grain and hop amounts wtf is wrong with this app

Never gets updates and probably never will. UI is broken with graphic glitches and and all around terrible interface. I CANT DELETE MASH STEPS! Which makes one of the most important parts of my recipe, calculating volumes and strike temps, a major pain.
I like the app a lot but it needs to update the ingredients lists.  There are more hops, malts, etc it needs to add.
This app is a great companion tool for the serious homebrewer. Easy to recommend as a mobile extension of the Beersmith toolbox.

Dont trust it. Too many issues. Why is yhis rated so high by everyone - do they actually USE it for brewday? Changing equip profile items doesnt refresh recipes using that profile for one thing. I have to scale to another profile then back again. Stupid. Scaling is also a kludge because because tied to a profile. Need redundant profiles for batch sizes. This shouldnt cost what it does considering all the problems and weird limitations. Relatively expensive vs most apps.

I was wondering if there were plans to add the functionality of entering grains or hops by percentage. I know it can be done long hand but would be nice to have that as an option when you find a recipe that only references percentage. Otherwise the app has been stable and there has been no issues with using it on my note tablet.
I may very well just be an idiot and missing something?! As far as I can see there isn't an option to just browse a list of types and recipes? Is this possible? It would be an absurd oversight.
The app is good, but I'd highly recommend the desktop version.
Minor issues with the save cancel buttons.  Otherwise love the up.  Wished it was updated more frequently.
Not as many ingredients as the pc version.
It took me a while to figure out why my mash never hit beer smith OG and I was getting frustrated,  but once I figured it out it's spot on for 72% effenciency!
This tool takes all the guess work out of Brewing. Why do all the calculations manually? Nice interface and has all the tools you need to plan and execute brew day.
The only brew app you need
The magic and power of Beersmith is now at your fingertips.
Love having my recipes synced on the cloud. Can start a recipe while away from a computer when an idea hits me and finish it up on Beersmith on my computer when I get home.
A great companion app. But it does crash every once and a while. But it is still worth paying for.
Defining a new equipment profile to change the batch size is extremely awkward. Also, the app sometimes fails to persist my metric units setting.
A lot of recipe crashes and mixups. Other than that, it's perfect. Very customisable
Not as functional as the PC version but hey...
This app takes all the need out of calculating bitterness and malt color so that you can concentrate on fine tuning your beer recipes. A must have for any homebrewer.
Can we have an option to sync with google drive? That would make it 5 stars for me.
What's not to love?
While there might be cheaper options, this is one robust app. Its usefulness to me as a brewer exceeded my expectations, and has dramatically changed the way I brew.
Works realy well. Makes planning and brewing beer easy. Lots of recipes to get you started. Add your own or edit existing.

So this should be called the beer Smith timer and recipe viewer. First off, this is not an iPhone app, the ui shouldn't look like one. Really bad ui! Also, you really can't do much editing. There is absolutely no way this would replace the desktop version.
Really lets you see every detail about the recipe you are making.

I really like how the app works. Pretty reliable, very few bugs that I've noticed. Only minor complaint is the design of the UI. It's just not fun to use. But it works great and is by far the best brew app in my opinion.
Does everything I need and more
So far has been very stable for me and the cloud copy is great. Haven't played with all the features, but , like the Desktop version appears to have been implemented by a good software engineer.
Great companion to the desktop BeerSmith program.
Perfect combination of recipe creation and brew day tools. Cant ask more.
Fantastic addition to the desktop I already use.
I had a question about BIAB calcs and the developer replied quickly. Thanks!
Easy to use
Great for recipe design.  But missing some calculators. Most importantly a water volume calculator.
Love this! This makes brew day so much easier
The one you must have during your brew session

I love being fully mobile with my Brewing software. Finally, the real deal professional grade program is available on Android. You can fully design not only the recipe but the brew day, fermentation and conditioning processes without being tied to your laptop.
replyContent: Kevin - I added your license to a special licensing list and send you a reply back to your email to resolve this.  Let me know if you have continued issues.

content: I would give it 5 stars if I could just import my desktop recipes, otherwise it does everything else.   Would love to get the ability to export a recipe via mobile (via text, html and/or file).
Used others, but this is the best and worth paying for
Love this app - you can do virtually everything from your smartphone or tablet that you can do on your PC. Easy to use and powerful. Great job!
An excellent brew companion app
I don't brew without this thing. Any calculation you might need to do is quickly done with this app.

This is great for tweaking a recipe and on a brew day. I still use the desktop software to make the recipe but not having the turn the computer on and being unable to take my tablet to the boiler and use the timer to guide you through the brew. You don't NEED both but they work better together...

Repeatable crash of the program when you click into number boxes then move cursor around within the number box to delete or change the number. Happens on my Asus TF300T tablet, but not on my Samsung galaxy nexus phone. :-(   Would be great to have default number pad instead of keyboard in the number boxes as well

I use this for all my homebrews. After my computer died and I lost my code for beersmith original, I decided to try to the app. I do not generally pay for an app, especially one over $1, but if u brew, this is a must have app for recipe creation. I love that I always have my recipes with me and can share them at bottle swaps or when someone asks about a recipe. The app is completely customizable for your brewing setup and adding custom equipment and ingredients is easy.

I love the ability to create and tweak recipes on the go, and the built in tools like ABV estimator are handy and eliminate separate apps I used to use.  What it doesn't do: I do wish it showed bitterness to gravity ratio like the desktop version, and especially wish that there was a more convenient brew day notes system. How about a brew day widget, with timer and notes area, etc? Prompts you to take gravity and volume readings on the hike screen.  Also, I wish it were a little easier to share recipes.
Not having a PC is not even a factor anymore. All of my recipes are with me no matter where I'm at. A nice way to create a recipe on the go if I have an idea that randomly pops in my head.
This is hands down the best investment a homebrewer can make.

Is useful as a brew timer, but it could be improved vastly. To developer...how about a cloud view of my in house inventory?  That would be very helpful when I go to the brew shop fo supplies. Or being able to select ingredients that are " in inventory"?  Also, I use earbuds and listen to mp3's when I brew. But the brew timer does not play alarms through the earbuds...it plays through the phone speaker only. I missed a couple steps due to this. Adjust these few things, and it would be a great app!

Most disapointed that there is no inventory management on the mobile app. This is standard in Beer Alchemy, and incredibly useful. Would not have purchased if I'd realised that this was missing on the mobile version. Buyers beware!

Brilliant app that has pretty much every calculator needed on a brew day.   Provided the recipe is already designed and loaded in the app you'll have no need to have the desktop version running whilst brewing.
I use this app to create and  organize my recipes. You wont be dispointed. A life saver for new home brewers

I just wish I could install the add-ons like on the desktop version. Im on the road a lot and do a good deal of recipe design on my phone and like to be able to throw together a quick recipe when something inspires me. I can always transfer over through the cloud and the app retains the updated ingredients, but only in that recipe. Otherwise this is an A+ app for any homebrewer!
All the info you need right on your tablet.  Check your recipe, converters and calculators.  Keep notes.  Perfect!
I have been using beersmith for years and it has helped me to be a better brewer. Now I can work on my recipes when I'm mobile. Thank you Brad Smith.
App works great and is very close to final results. A few javascript errors here and there but nothing serious.
A MUST HAVE APP FOR ALL BREWERS!
Works as expected. Never used desktop so I can't compare.
I love how easy this syncs withe my computer's beersmith files, so I can cary all my beer recipes around everywhere I go!
Love it!
Won't load grains or equipment profiles. Problems loading recipes. Lost recipes. Very unfortunate since I love the desktop program.

As a frequent user of the desktop version it is nice to be able to transfer the recipes to a cloud server.  Having the recipe on my phone is much more convenient than either printing the recipe or hauling a laptop around during brewday. Also the ability to make adjustments on the fly is great! As are the tools and timers. I still prefer the desktop version for all the major tweaking and recipe building. Great app though. Thanks Brad!
Great app supplies all my brewing needs

This app is a great companion to the desktop software. The tools are handy, but the brew timer is the real winner, it means you don't need you computer on brew day, just your phone.  Only bug, the units seem to switch back from metric to imperial on restart, this would be a good one to fix. (bug was on Samsung Galaxy S2)
I use BeerSmith desktop as well, and I was mostly getting the mobile app to complement my desktop recipes. It does that well enough, however it is a bit laborious to transfer recipes.

I bought this app specifically to scale all greain recipies to 3 gallon batches forever stovetop brewing.  Its impossibly difficult and I wish I had saved my money. Also the other additives stay in ounces even when units is set to metric
This is first class beer brewing application. I used this to design and make my first IPA. Can't brew without it now.
Great work Brad. I would love to have a yeast starter calculator added to this. Your desktop formula is much closer to Mr. Malty than Brewzors calculator.
A great tool to help you make better beer.
After initial problem which seemed to be a corrupt download, all is now good, many thanks to Brad for excellent follow up customer care. You rock.

I haven't used it too much yet but was a long time desktop version user until my laptop died.  Now that I only have a tablet this is all I got.  Brad helped me upload all my saved recipes that I had on the desktop version which I greatly appreciated.  I wish this app version had the ability to sort my older recipes by date brewed and had a calendar to keep track of any new recipes.  This is really how I view my recipes mentally.  Also wish there was an inventory function like the desktop version.  Here's to hoping some of these things will eventually be added....

I just had an issue with my program, emailed Brad for support and within 40 min he had messaged me back with a fix. Awesome customer service. He is actively listening to user comments looking for improvements. Let him know your issues.

I expected this app to be 5 stars. I love beersmith on the desktop. This version does not have many features that are necessary to make the best beer possible.   I am sure these features will be added. Then it will deserve 5 stars.  REQUEST: Please add external automation interface. Thanks

I love BeerSmith on my desktop, and I've waited for the app to hit Android. I'm sure I would love it if I could use it. A lot of the entry fields just does not support text entry. Tried SwiftKey, and Android native keyboard but no luck. I'm expecting this issue to be fixed and my review probably be a lot more positive then.   Tested on: LG Nexus 4, Android 4.3 (JWR66Y)

I got the mobile version as a supplement to the desktop version. I'm using the software with android 4.1.  Editing is painful at best. Sometimes it takes the keyboard entry and other times you need to exit the program and reenter in order for it to work. If you start the timer and change screens you can't get back to the timer and brew steps without resetting the timer.   I'm a bit disappointed in it.   Brewing salt additions aren't calculated for a given water profile.  Hope a fixed version comes out soon.
So far I am loving this app I can switch from the Mac to Windows laptop and my phone

A well appointed app. Very usable, and well researched. Customer support was quick and responsive. A great value. I had trouble with java script errors after updating but this was solved by uninstalling and then deleting the associated "com." file in my data folder. Now works great!

Has some bugs. Can't type in many of the fields. Have to continually close it and restart just to get one recipe done. I wouldn't have spent the money if I knew how it functioned. If it worked it would be a great app.

Lagginess significantly reduced with update, but still slightly buggy when navigating.  Also, would like to be able to adjust the hydrometer calibration temp. Not all hydrometers are calibrated the same.
Everything you need to calculate your own beer recipes. I never brew without it. Connects seemlessly to beersmith on my pc.
JavaScript errors resolved.
Fantastic

The app itself is awesome. Would love to see what it does on a tablet, but i have to agree with everyone else, a new interface would really up the quality of the app.   A small suggestions, change the default screen colors and remove some of the rounded corners. That alone will make quite the difference.

Great mash calculator with a bunch of different options.  The grain/hop database is great as well because it has pretty much everything and doesn't have doubles.  Loads quick on the phone too, so it's easy to pull up at your lhbs.  It can be buggy at times, so definitely keep your recipes local and in the cloud.
replyContent: Corrected all known javascript errors with updates - if still having problems please message me via the BeerSmith web site.

content: Of have issues with this app just talk to the developer, i had one issue where java was being a pain, he fixed it within 24 hours. Very impressed with the turnover.
Awesome for brew day and shopping, just add option to automate cloud sync for whole recipe library

Great for recipe planning and brew day work; love the cloud integration.	I've been a user of BrewSmith for several years, wishing for a mobile version with recipe portability.  I'm happy to say, this app doesn't disappoint.  While it doesn't do everything the desktop version can, it sure is feature-rich, particularly things you need on brew day, which is why I got it.  The timers are very handy and the ability to enter brew session data (such as volume out of mash into kettle, incl pre-boil gravity, etc) make it convenient to stay on top of the process.  I also love being able to start planning a recipe on the desktop, move it to the cloud, and continue through a mobile device.  Shopping for ingredients should be easier as well, although I haven't used it for that yet.  The app had its hiccups when I first started using it, which I reported to the developer via e-mail and their forum.  The developer's reply was fast (same day), with an app update fast too (next day!).  This is not to say expectations should always be the same, as response time varies depending on many factors (including the complexity of the fix), but this sure is reassuring and shows commitment on the dev's part.  Overall, I highly recommend this app and the ecosystem it's part of.

Love this app just as robust as the full pc version. But I would like to see a change to the fields that are ment for numbers only to switch automatically to a number key pad. Do this and its a five-star
Works great for on the go recipie formulation or shopping list. Wish cloud was more automatic.
Could be great, wish it were a little more intuitive like the desktop app.  Seems like I'm always fighting with it to add ingredients or change profiles.
Can't login to cloud, unable to type login info. Using Asus Android tablet
replyContent: You can change the login/password from the options page.  If you don't have an account you can set one up at BeerSmithRecipes for free.

content: With a lot of work this could be a fantastic app. I hope my $8 helps move towards that. Can't choose batch size, can't change equipment profile.  Such potential that falls flat on its face.  3 stars for the potential. revision 7-15-13: after the update many more things are working. Something huge is still missing for my purpose. To be able to just choose batch size. Currently as far as I can see you can only change equipment profiles. I'm experimenting with 1 gallon biab batches and just want batch sizing.

Best beer making app out there. Lots of thought went into this mobile version and it shows. Want to increase the quality and consistency of your beer, then use this app.  Coupled with cloud storage its a great way to research others and back up your beer.
Wish it was not html5 app, other than that, decent

Doesn't work a good portion of the time.  Timers stop arbitrary.  Other times you tap on a category and nothing happens, still busted after force stop, powering down phone.  Recipes stored locally on phone disappeared, no backup option, cloud only stores 15 recipes.    Has a lot of promise, stick with the desktop version.  ---------------- Even after months of updates this is buggy as hell.  Recipes get corrupted and again lost multiple recipes again.  I really want this to work but it is just not worth it
replyContent: I believe the crashes have been fixed in the latest updates (update your app).  If you are still having problems please visit my website and send an email and I'm sure we can resolve it quickly.

content: Great app to be able to correct the difference between a hydrometer and a refractometer , all works well , great app , thanks
This app has huge potential to be useful but some flaws make it about useless.   Java script corrupts regularly.  Can't hold to backspace to clear values or text input freezes. (requires app restart)
I can't formulate recipes using this, go into ibu for eg, set it and save or back out, not saved. Not happy at all.
Great app. My only issue is that it will only store two recipes on my device at a time. The others either will not load or disappear.

An IPA recipe with 90 IBUs created on my computer and imported to my phone via cloud shows 60 IBUs. Same units, rager; same water volumes, hops additions and acid.  Why?  If I created this recipe in my phone I would have messed up my IBUs big time! Edit: it turns out it takes a while, editing and entering the program/app again for the units to refresh/change. So far so good.
replyContent: Check to make sure you have the same hop estimating equation on both systems (Options->Bitterness).

content: I already use beerSmith on my computer, so this was a convenient way to look at recipes or  transport my recipe catalog to the brew store. I got tired of writing or printing recipes when I go to the brew store.  This has turned out to be a pretty handy app for that Plus I can search for recipes online anytime I want move them to the cloud and then upload to my computer. I haven't tried brewing with it or building a recipe. Now if they would just add that parti-gyle feature!

*Edit* The batch size issue is killing me and this app is unusable until this gets resolved. I am also unable to save a new equipment profile. I brew 5.5 gal or 6 gal batches normally so I end up with 5 gal at bottling. I *need* to be able to adjust batch size in order to use this app.
replyContent: Just set up an equipment profile under Profiles->Equipment (or save one from an existing recipe) and then use that equipment profile for any of your recipes.

content: Finally a functioning brewing app for android!
Has everything included so I can log and record all measurements on tablet

I have updated my review since the last update. Performance issues have been fixed for my device, and the program runs much more smoothly. I would still like to see it with a more standard Android interface, but overall the app is good.

I'm a huge fan of Beersmith, and have been using the mobile versions since day one. The only thing that is really missing is the ability to sync your ingredient inventory! That would be really helpful to create recipes on the fly.
After you allow some time to download ingredient lists this is awesome. Great work Brad!
Please convert it to a native app. Some scaling issues on SG2. 4 stars for usefullness. Good work.
My only real wish is that it was prettier.
The yeast starter tool is mobile!

Even with some of the negative reviews I downloaded anyway knowing that Brad Smith would produce quality software. I wasn't disappointed. Any little hiccups with the program are minor and I know how well polished the desktop version is. With future updates this will be perfect too. Already it is fantastic and I have brewed a porter designed completely on the mobile version and it looks like it will be awesome. Thanks Brad, I was waiting on this
Much improved over initial release. Great app, and content. Will give 5 stars when it looks like an Android app, and takes advantage of its additional features.
Worked great long enough to make a recipe. Now it won't open any recipes or anything on the cloud. Would be cool if those would open. That's 12 dollars in beer smith apps that do nothing.
replyContent: The crash issues related to late extract additions were fixed with the latest update - give the update a try.

content: Doesn't look like a real mobile application. Not sure what OS this is for but it isn't android. Refund and uninstalled.

Might as well call this one a beta.   I was unable to do any proper recipe building on the app. When trying to add a particular quantity of extract, the app crashes. When I was trying to change other ingredients or access menus, the app crashed.  Beyond the buggy recipe building, the app's notifications are silent and there's no (easily apparent) way to change this. This app is also extremely ugly and uses almost no style or feature that you'd expect from current gen Android app. If I were using this on an old G1, I might actually enjoy it.   Fix the bugs, fix the terrible UI, and this might be worth some money.
I had an issue at first where it kept freezing but Brad help me fix it. You can trust all of the Beer Smith products because of the outstanding customer support.

After playing with this for a few days, I find it frustrating. The features are great, but the performance is awful. It can take close to a minute for the keyboard to appear when applicable, and it is terribly slow all around. It also looks like an iPhone app...what's up with that? I wish it had a free trial because I probably would have saved myself the money. I really hope the developer gets these issues resolved.
Have poked around and it looks great!  Looking forward to brewing with it!
While there is room for improvement, especially in regards to responsiveness, the app is a much better than Lite.
Excellent so far. Looking forward to kicking the tires.
Seems to have everything I need.  I would give it a 5 start but it looks like an HTML5-base app so the performance on my LG Spectrum 2 isn't what it might be if it were a compiled app.  Nice work!

I already own BeerSmith2, so I wondered if this would be useful. It is! The My Cloud Recipes feature allowed me to bring in my existing recipes, along with my equipment and mash profiles (as part of those recipes). So far, going back and forth is seamless. All the major features are there (including the recipe sliders). The timers are great on a tablet, even if the control buttons could be a tad bigger. Worth it!
Only thing I would recommend is use the Holo Standard
Had a good muck about this morning and it's simple to use and does the job.

I've only played around with this for about 20 minutes, but I can tell it's going to be a great companion to Beersmith on my PC.  Importing my recipes was a cinch, as well as my profiles.  My only constructive criticism would be to follow more along Google's Holo standard and/or have an option for a dark theme.  Great job Brad!
